p: Details on the modeling are given in [1] and are summarised in Fig. 2. We selected 17 Worldclim variables relating to climate that are likely to influence the distribution of the birds, mammals, plants, reptiles and amphibians in the Albertine Rift. All the predictor variables were clipped to the area of interest and a pairwise Pearson correlation between predictor variables were obtained using ENMTOOLs [6]. To minimize the effect of multi-collinearity and overfitting, only seven variables with less than (Â± 0.75) correlation were retained ( Table 1). Threshold layers, representing binary (presence/absence) predictions of the distribution for each species were made maximising sensitivity and specificity [7].
